head.supplied: [Delegate, 5 May 1887] ¶ ¶ [...] ¶ ¶ Your remarks about ¶ Euc. amygd. ¶ confirm my experience, and I find that a tree growing here determined by Baron von Müller to be ¶ Euc. viminalis (var) ¶ o...

div.p: Wilhelm Bäuerlen to Joseph Henry Maiden
MRS 202/122 special bundle, collector, Archives of the Museum of Applied Arts and Sciences, Ultimo, New South Wales.

Your remarks about Euc. amygd. confirm my experience, and I find that a tree growing here determined by Baron von Müller to be Euc. viminalis (var) of which I sent you Leaves, Bark & Gum in last supply is quite different in every respect from the usual Euc. viminalis of which I now send you a spec. of timber. However I shall from this out look out for every possible variety. In my opinion, as far as my limited experience goes, the leaves of young plants or suckers sprouting from old trees give one of the most distinctive characteristics, therefore in the specimens I shall send you from this out, I shall especially look to that feature.
